comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Installing Cygwin
2. Setting PATH environment to /bin path
3. compiling CDT project
4. starting debugging


More information:
My configuration:

WinXP Prof SP2
Cygwin with ...
     gcc: gcc-Version 3.4.4 (cygming special, gdc 0.12, using dmd 0.125)
     gdb: GNU gdb 6.5.50.20060706


     Eclipse 3.2.0
     CDT 3.1.2.200702150621

or

     Eclipse 3.3.0
     CDT 4.0.0.200705251830

I have problems with cygwin environment. Compiling is no problem but debugging is not possible. It does not depend on eclipse/cdt version. The debugging perspective is opened but the debugger does not run on any breakpoint. The error is the same with all debugger versions (cygwin gdb,GDB, GDB/MI).

The log shows allways the following:

What can I do? With CDT 3.0 I did not have this problem! With MinGW environment debugging works fine.

> org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.MIException: BFD: BFD 2.17.50 20060706 internal
> error, aborting at /netrel/src/gdb-20060706-2/bfd/coffcode.h line 841 in
> handle_COMDAT

> What can I do? With CDT 3.0 I did not have this problem! With MinGW environment
> debugging works fine.

This should give you a couple of hints. You're gdb is crashing. This appears to be a cygwin gdb problem, probably related to the file format you are using (coff?)

traces.message: BFD: BFD 2.17.50 20060706 internal error, aborting at /netrel/src/gdb-20060706-2/bfd/coffcode.h line 841 in handle_COMDAT
